message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE 

This paper is about natural language processing and sequence modeling, which are typically categorized under cs.CL (Computation and Language). The use of attention mechanisms and reinforcement learning also suggests a possible fit under cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Additionally, the paper mentions the use of CNNs (Convolutional Neural Networks) for sentence encoding, which could place it under cs.CV (Computer Vision). Finally, the use of policy gradient for training the hard attention mechanism suggests a possible fit under cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
